sn23.34:4.2: Venerable Rādha said to the Buddha:
sn23.34:4.3: “Sir, may the Buddha please teach me Dharma in brief. When I’ve heard it, I’ll live alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and determined.”
sn23.34:5.1: “Rādha, you should give up any desire, any greed, any desire and greed for whatever is liable to cease.
sn23.34:5.3: And what is liable to cease?
sn23.34:5.5: You should give up any desire, any greed, any desire and greed for it.
sn23.34:5.13: You should give up any desire, any greed, any desire and greed for it.
sn23.34:5.14: You should give up any desire, any greed, any desire and greed for whatever is liable to cease.”
